about_the_game:
You're late. We were about to start without you. 

Through that elevator on your left, please. And then down the hallway - don't lollygag, we're behind enough as it is.
If the elevator stops, under no circumstances should you exit before reaching the correct floor.   Repeat that to me please so I know you understood it. 
Ok, thank you.
When you get there, take a seat at the center table. The test will begin shortly. Do not speak to the other participants.  Do not take any photographs. Do not write down your memories of it. And do not look directly into the slide projector.

What? No, it's a slide projector - it won't do any damage. But you won't be able to see.  And we need you to see. 


If the test ends prematurely, do be a dear and try again. Sometimes all you need is a fresh mind to a problem to get a different result. 





Silkbulb Test is a psychological horror game where you are the Participant to the Silkbulb Test.
You sit alone in a dark room. You cannot move. The controls are simple - you move the slides forward by pressing one of two buttons. You make a choice. Right or Left. True or False. Red or Yellow. How you choose will determine the outcome of the Test and whether you are fit to continue.

The demo should take 10-15 minutes depending on the Participant and should be considered a teaser for the full game. The full game may or may not contain the content of the demo but should be considered representative of it.

The controls:

Left Mouse to interact.
WASD to move both the player and certain slide mechanics.
Tab/Esc to pause.

I would highly recommend you wear headphones for the duration of the Test.

content_descriptors.notes: There are depictions of blood and frightening images.
